definitions: To start ringing loudly (of an alarm or bell).
To leave a place, often suddenly or for a specific purpose.
To become spoiled or no longer fresh (of food or drink).
To happen or proceed in a particular way.
examples: The bomb goes off at midnight.
My alarm goes off at 6 AM.
He goes off to college next year.
The milk goes off quickly in this heat.
The party goes off without a hitch.
